psychographics.lifestyle: Style-curious shoppers who want trend-right looks, seasonal updates, and wardrobe essentials at accessible prices
psychographics.behavior: High frequency browsing, seasonal buying, collaboration-drop interest, mixing basics with statement pieces

tone_of_voice.communication_style: Direct, energizing, and customer-first with a focus on self-expression and accessibility
preferred_structures: Campaign taglines tied to season or collaboration
tone_dos: Use confident, upbeat phrasing without overpromising

logo.primary_logo: H&M wordmark in bold, hand-drawn brush-script style (typically red).
logo.usage_rules: Use the wordmark as a strong identifier with clear space; avoid clutter and avoid placing over complex textures that reduce legibility.
logo.lockup_behavior: Often top-corner or centered placement depending on campaign; maintain consistent scale and clean negative space around the mark.
logo.safe_area: Minimum padding equals the height of the “H” stroke around the logo.

color_system.color_usage_rules: Red is the signature brand identifier; campaigns may use seasonal palettes, but the logo should remain high-contrast and immediately readable.

typography.secondary_font: Modern sans-serif for product/category details; bold weights for headlines

layout_principles.white_space_ratio: Moderate to generous depending on campaign type (collab/editorial vs product-led)
layout_principles.image_vs_text_balance: Image-led with minimal copy in hero placements; more copy in ecommerce/product contexts
layout_principles.cta_placement: Lower third or bottom-right in digital placements; minimal CTAs in brand campaigns
layout_principles.alignment: Centered hero subjects with logo anchoring; occasional dynamic diagonal compositions in collab campaigns

preferred_photographers: Alasdair McLellan (example: David Beckham Bodywear campaign). citeturn2image0
Steven Meisel (example: H&M x Moschino campaign imagery credited widely). citeturn2image5
Campaign-specific photographers for designer collaborations (e.g., ERDEM x H&M campaign credits). citeturn2image4
style.camera_feel: Polished commercial fashion imagery that shifts between clean studio minimalism and narrative lifestyle/editorial setups (especially for collaborations and holidays). citeturn1search16turn2image4turn2image2
style.pose_guidelines: Confident, approachable poses; strong body language; group compositions that signal community and inclusivity in collaboration campaigns. citeturn2image2turn2image5
style.casting_attitude: Mix of celebrities and high-fashion models; diversity and breadth to reflect ‘for the many’. citeturn1news35turn4search11

technical.lighting: Varies by campaign: crisp studio light for product clarity; cinematic or festive lighting for seasonal storytelling. citeturn1search16turn2image0turn2image5
technical.contrast: Medium to high; black-and-white used strategically for iconic, timeless bodywear/editorial campaigns. citeturn2image0turn2image6
technical.grain: Low to subtle; clean digital look is common in commercial executions
technical.depth_of_field: Moderate; shallow DOF for portrait/editorial moments, deeper focus for group and environment storytelling
technical.color_grading: Clean, modern grading; seasonal warmth for holiday; strong saturation and metallic accents in designer collabs. citeturn1search16turn2image2turn2image5

preferred_locations: Festive staged worlds for holiday campaigns. citeturn1search16turn2image5

model_casting.diversity: Broad representation aligned with ‘for the many’. citeturn4search11turn4search2
model_casting.attitude: Approachable confidence; playful energy in holiday; assertive glamour in designer collaborations. citeturn1search16turn2image2

product_presentation.hero_visibility: Product is clear and wearable; in collaboration campaigns, statement pieces and branding are foregrounded; in lifestyle campaigns, product integrates into the moment.
product_presentation.styling_approach: Mix of accessible basics and trend statements; strong styling shift for designer collaborations (ornate, logo-forward, high-drama silhouettes). citeturn2image2turn2image5turn2image4
avoid: Unrealistic couture-only framing that conflicts with accessibility
Overly niche subcultural codes that reduce mass appeal

motion_rules.transitions: Clean cuts; occasional stylized transitions for holiday/fantasy setups

visual_dos: Use the logo as a bold signature anchor
Prioritize outfit readability and styling clarity
Use inclusive casting and contemporary settings
Allow campaign worlds to shift seasonally while keeping brand accessibility consistent
visual_donts: Overly complex layouts that reduce legibility
Muted logo treatment that loses brand recognition
Excessive luxury-coding that contradicts mass accessibility

materials: Flexible merchandising to support fast seasonal refresh

digital.tone_adjustment: Short, clear copy and strong visuals; campaign video loops and shoppable category-first navigation

platform_behavior.Instagram: Fast-paced seasonal drops, collaboration hype, inclusive casting moments
platform_behavior.Website: Product-led browsing with campaign hero modules
platform_behavior.Newsletter: Short headlines, clear category CTAs, hero visuals

print.paper: Standard coated stock for mass distribution; premium finishes for collaboration lookbooks when produced
print.cover_rules: Strong hero image; logo top/center with high contrast; minimal text

logo_misuse_examples: Low-contrast red logo on warm red backgrounds
Logo over highly patterned garments without a contrast buffer
Over-scaling the logo so it competes with the product silhouette
